questions.question: How can I change the product name in the NEC MSBU portal?
questions.answer: Navigate to Product Information Management > Products > Released products or Released products by category. questions.question: How to generate an electric journal in NEC MSBU?

questions.question: What is the purpose of the MIES self-service console?
questions.answer: The MIES self-service console serves the purpose of enabling all users to submit and track their requests and tickets. It also provides tools to help users resolve minor IT issues, such as resetting passwords and managing user profiles.

questions.question: What functionalities does the MIES self-service console offer?
questions.answer: The MIES self-service console offers various functionalities, including the ability for users to view their submitted, assigned, and pending tickets easily. It also allows users to act upon tickets that require immediate attention, facilitating faster resolution and processing time.

questions.question: How does the console help users in resolving IT issues?
questions.answer: The console aids users in resolving IT issues by providing tools for tasks like resetting passwords and managing user profiles. Users can view all their tickets, including assigned and pending ones, without manually searching through numerous tickets in the incident and service request modules.

questions.question: Can I track the status of my submitted tickets in the MIES self-service console?
questions.answer: Yes, you can easily track the status of your submitted tickets in the MIES self-service console. The user ticket pages organize all tickets for convenient viewing, and there's a dedicated My Ticket Overview module for comprehensive tracking of tickets logged under your name, assigned, or pending your action.

questions.question: Tell me about the My Ticket Overview page in the MIES self-service console.
questions.answer: The My Ticket Overview page is a comprehensive module where users can view all tickets logged under their name, assigned, or pending their action. To access it, users can navigate to the main menu, go to Self-Service, and then click on My Ticket Overview.

questions.question: What is the scope of the document guiding readers on the self-service console functionalities?
questions.answer: The document aims to guide readers on the different functionalities and pages of the MIES self-service console. It demonstrates how the tools can be efficiently utilized for service provision, making it a valuable resource for users looking to optimize their experience with the console.

questions.question: How do resolvers access ITSM tools in the MIES self-service console?
questions.answer: Resolvers, including the Service Desk team, have quick access to ITSM tools in the MIES self-service console. These tools assist in resolving incidents and fulfilling service requests without the need to manually go to the incident management or service request management modules.

questions.question: What is the navigation path to access the My Ticket Overview page?
questions.answer: To access the My Ticket Overview page, users need to navigate to the main menu, select Self-Service, and then click on My Ticket Overview. This provides users with a comprehensive view of all tickets associated with their name, assigned, or pending their action.

questions.question: What is the purpose of MIES Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)?
questions.answer: MIES Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) serves the purpose of providing all users with additional security when logging into their accounts in the portal. It seamlessly integrates into the portal, allowing users to verify their accounts quickly and easily using their mobile devices.

questions.question: How does MIES Multi-Factor Authentication enhance security?
questions.answer: With the integrated Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA), MIES ensures more stability and security. This enhancement contributes to an improved user experience while keeping user data extra secured during logins.

questions.question: What is the scope of the guide for MIES Multi-Factor Authentication?
questions.answer: The guide aims to show readers how to pair their authenticator app with MIES and log in with multi-factor authentication. It provides step-by-step instructions for users to set up and utilize this additional layer of security.

questions.question: What are the prerequisites for setting up Multi-Factor Authentication in MIES?
questions.answer: To activate Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA), users must have an account created in the MIES portal and Time-based One-Time Passwords (TOTP) enabled. Additionally, users need to download an authenticator application, such as Microsoft or Google authenticators, to generate TOTPs for authentication.

questions.question: How do I activate Multi-Factor Authentication in the MIES portal?
questions.answer: To activate Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) in the MIES portal, ensure you have an account created and Time-based One-Time Passwords (TOTP) enabled. Download an authenticator application, like Microsoft or Google authenticators, to generate TOTPs. If you encounter any issues, contact the Service Desk team or portal administrators for assistance.

questions.question: Can I use any authenticator app for Multi-Factor Authentication in MIES?
questions.answer: Yes, users can use either Microsoft or Google authenticators for Multi-Factor Authentication in MIES. Ensure the selected authenticator app is downloaded and set up to generate Time-based One-Time Passwords (TOTP) for authentication.

questions.question: What should I do if I encounter issues with setting up Multi-Factor Authentication?
questions.answer: If you encounter any issues with setting up Multi-Factor Authentication, contact the Service Desk team or portal administrators. They can provide assistance and help rectify any problems to ensure a smooth activation of this additional security layer.

questions.question: How does Multi-Factor Authentication contribute to a more secure login process?
questions.answer: Multi-Factor Authentication enhances security during the login process by requiring additional verification steps beyond just a password. Users can quickly and easily verify their accounts using their mobile devices, ensuring a more robust authentication process.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the MIES service request catalog console?
questions.answer: The MIES service request catalog console allows portal administrators to create catalog items for users to submit their service requests to the Service Desk team. It enables customization of different service request types for various companies within one console, with minimal coding required.

questions.question: How does the service request catalog console ensure efficient service request management?
questions.answer: The service request catalog console allows portal administrators to create customized service request forms for each request type. This ensures that all necessary details can be efficiently collected from users, leading to satisfactory request approvals and fulfillment.

questions.question: What is the scope of the guide for operating the service request catalog?
questions.answer: The guide aims to inform readers on how to operate the service request catalog in creating new request types and forms for users to utilize. It provides step-by-step instructions without requiring coding expertise, making the process accessible for administrators.

questions.question: How can portal administrators access the Service Request Catalog in MIES?
questions.answer: Portal administrators can access the Service Request Catalog by first logging into the MIES portal at https://mies.nec-eportal.com.sg/Login. After logging in, they can navigate to the main menu, select Administration, then go to System, and finally click on Service Request Catalog.

questions.question: What are the steps for creating new service request categories in the console?
questions.answer: To create new service request categories, portal administrators first select the company from the drop-down menu. They can then add a main category, providing details such as the name, description, assigned group, approval workflow, and sort order. Sub-categories can be added similarly, ensuring efficient organization of catalog items.

questions.question: How can portal administrators duplicate existing categories in the Service Request Catalog?
questions.answer: Portal administrators can duplicate existing categories by selecting the category of their choice and clicking on Duplicate. This creates a copy with similar settings, except the sort order is increased by 1. They can then edit the duplicated category as needed.

questions.question: What precautions should portal administrators take when deleting categories in the console?
questions.answer: When deleting categories, portal administrators should ensure that no users are actively using that service request to minimize disruption. They can select the category and click Delete to permanently remove it from the console.

questions.question: How many main and sub-categories can be created in the Service Request Catalog?
questions.answer: There is no set limit to how many main and sub-categories can be created in the Service Request Catalog. Portal administrators are recommended to plan ahead and create categories based on the needs of the company to ensure smooth ticket submissions.
